cloudProvider.title: Cloud Provider (Platform Layer)
cloudProvider.description: Owns the marketplace platform infrastructure and capabilities [cite: 84-85].
responsibilities: Discovery & Search: Maintain product catalog and vendor listings [cite: 86, 306-307].
Platform Security: Secure infrastructure and prevent transaction fraud [cite: 87, 308-309].
Transaction Infrastructure: Process payments and billing aggregation [cite: 88, 310-311].
Entitlement Management: Grant/revoke access and manage subscriptions [cite: 89, 312-313].
Governance Capabilities: Provide IAM frameworks and private marketplace tools [cite: 90, 315-316].
Spend Visibility: Cost reports and usage analytics [cite: 91, 317-318].
Standard Contracts: Maintain SCMP and licensing models [cite: 92, 319-320].

vendor.title: Third-Party Vendor (Product Layer)
vendor.description: Owns everything related to the product and commercial offers[cite: 95].
responsibilities: Product Security: Application security and vulnerability management [cite: 97, 329-330].
Software Functionality: Features, performance, and uptime [cite: 97, 331-332].
Updates & Maintenance: Patches, upgrades, and bug fixes [cite: 97, 333-334].
Licensing & Compliance: Usage rights and compliance attestations (SOC2, etc.) [cite: 97, 335-336].
Support & SLAs: Customer support and service level commitments [cite: 97, 337-338].
Pricing & Commercial Terms: Set pricing models and discount structures [cite: 98, 339-340].
Private Offer Creation: Create custom offers and respond to amendments [cite: 99, 341-342].

customer.title: Customer Organization (Governance & Workflow Layer)
customer.description: Owns internal coordination and connecting marketplace to enterprise systems [cite: 102-103].
responsibilities: Procurement Strategy: Channel decisions and vendor selection [cite: 105, 351-352].
Cross-Functional Alignment: Process definition across 9+ teams [cite: 106, 353-354].
Vendor Assessment: Security review and third-party risk scoring [cite: 107, 355-356].
Contract Management: Legal review and amendment tracking [cite: 107, 357-358].
Financial Management: Budget allocation and PO management [cite: 108, 359-360].
Integration & Deployment: ERP integration and user provisioning [cite: 109, 361-362].
Policy Definition: Security baselines and spending thresholds [cite: 111, 363-364].
doesNotOwn: Vendor product roadmaps or security architecture[cite: 112, 367].
